trans-unit.source: Migrate from Mobile Services to an App Service Mobile App
trans-unit.target: Migrate from Mobile Services to an App Service Mobile App

trans-unit.source: Learn how to easily migrate your Mobile Services application to an App Service Mobile App
trans-unit.target: Learn how to easily migrate your Mobile Services application to an App Service Mobile App

trans-unit.source: Migrate your existing Azure Mobile Service to Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Migrate your existing Azure Mobile Service to Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: With the [general availability of Azure App Service], Azure Mobile Services sites can be easily migrated in-place to take advantage of all the
trans-unit.target: With the [general availability of Azure App Service], Azure Mobile Services sites can be easily migrated in-place to take advantage of all the

trans-unit.source: features of the Azure App Service.
trans-unit.target: features of the Azure App Service.

trans-unit.source: This document explains what to expect when migrating your site from Azure Mobile Services to Azure App Service.
trans-unit.target: This document explains what to expect when migrating your site from Azure Mobile Services to Azure App Service.

trans-unit.source: What does migration do to your site
trans-unit.target: What does migration do to your site

trans-unit.source: Migration of your Azure Mobile Service will turn your Mobile Service into an [Azure App Service] app without affecting the code in any way.
trans-unit.target: Migration of your Azure Mobile Service will turn your Mobile Service into an [Azure App Service] app without affecting the code in any way.

trans-unit.source: Your Notification
trans-unit.target: Your Notification

trans-unit.source: Hubs, SQL data connection, authentication settings, scheduled jobs, and domain name will remain unchanged.
trans-unit.target: Hubs, SQL data connection, authentication settings, scheduled jobs, and domain name will remain unchanged.

trans-unit.source: Mobile clients using your Azure Mobile Service
trans-unit.target: Mobile clients using your Azure Mobile Service

trans-unit.source: will continue to operate normally.
trans-unit.target: will continue to operate normally.

trans-unit.source: Migration will restart your service once it is transferred to Azure App Service.
trans-unit.target: Migration will restart your service once it is transferred to Azure App Service.

trans-unit.source: Why you should migrate your site
trans-unit.target: Why you should migrate your site

trans-unit.source: Microsoft is recommending that you migrate your Azure Mobile Service to take advantage of the features of Azure App Service, including:
trans-unit.target: Microsoft is recommending that you migrate your Azure Mobile Service to take advantage of the features of Azure App Service, including:

trans-unit.source: New host features, including [WebJobs] and [custom domain names].
trans-unit.target: New host features, including [WebJobs] and [custom domain names].

trans-unit.source: Connectivity to your on-premise resources using [VNet] in addition to [Hybrid Connections].
trans-unit.target: Connectivity to your on-premise resources using [VNet] in addition to [Hybrid Connections].

trans-unit.source: Monitoring and troubleshooting with New Relic or [Application Insights].
trans-unit.target: Monitoring and troubleshooting with New Relic or [Application Insights].

trans-unit.source: Built-in DevOps tooling, including [staging slots], roll-back and in-production testing.
trans-unit.target: Built-in DevOps tooling, including [staging slots], roll-back and in-production testing.

trans-unit.source: [Auto-scale], load balancing and [performance monitoring].
trans-unit.target: [Auto-scale], load balancing and [performance monitoring].

trans-unit.source: For more information on the benefits of Azure App Service, see the [Mobile Services vs. App Service] topic.
trans-unit.target: For more information on the benefits of Azure App Service, see the [Mobile Services vs. App Service] topic.

trans-unit.source: Why you should not migrate your site
trans-unit.target: Why you should not migrate your site

trans-unit.source: There are a few reasons why you should not migrate your Azure Mobile Services now:
trans-unit.target: There are a few reasons why you should not migrate your Azure Mobile Services now:

trans-unit.source: You are currently in a busy period and cannot afford a site restart at this time.
trans-unit.target: You are currently in a busy period and cannot afford a site restart at this time.

trans-unit.source: You do not wish to affect your production site before testing the migration process.
trans-unit.target: You do not wish to affect your production site before testing the migration process.

trans-unit.source: You have multiple sites in the Free or Basic pricing tiers and do not want to migrate all sites at the same time.
trans-unit.target: You have multiple sites in the Free or Basic pricing tiers and do not want to migrate all sites at the same time.

trans-unit.source: In you are in a busy period, then please plan to migrate during a scheduled maintenance window.
trans-unit.target: In you are in a busy period, then please plan to migrate during a scheduled maintenance window.

trans-unit.source: The migration process restarts your
trans-unit.target: The migration process restarts your

trans-unit.source: site as part of the process and your users may notice this momentary availability disruption.
trans-unit.target: site as part of the process and your users may notice this momentary availability disruption.

trans-unit.source: There are workarounds for most of the items in this list.
trans-unit.target: There are workarounds for most of the items in this list.

trans-unit.source: Please refer to the [Before you begin](#before-you-begin) section below for details.
trans-unit.target: Please refer to the [Before you begin](#before-you-begin) section below for details.

trans-unit.source: Before you begin
trans-unit.target: Before you begin

trans-unit.source: You should follow the following steps before migrating your site:
trans-unit.target: You should follow the following steps before migrating your site:

trans-unit.source: [Back up your Mobile Service] scripts and SQL database
trans-unit.target: [Back up your Mobile Service] scripts and SQL database

trans-unit.source: (Optional) Raise the Mobile Service tier to Standard
trans-unit.target: (Optional) Raise the Mobile Service tier to Standard

trans-unit.source: If you wish to test the migration process before migrating your production site, duplicate your production Azure Mobile Service (complete
trans-unit.target: If you wish to test the migration process before migrating your production site, duplicate your production Azure Mobile Service (complete

trans-unit.source: with a copy of the data source) and test the migration against the new URL.
trans-unit.target: with a copy of the data source) and test the migration against the new URL.

trans-unit.source: You will also need a test client implementation that points
trans-unit.target: You will also need a test client implementation that points

trans-unit.source: to the test site to properly test the migrated site.
trans-unit.target: to the test site to properly test the migrated site.

trans-unit.source: (Optional) Raise the Mobile Service tier to Standard
trans-unit.target: (Optional) Raise the Mobile Service tier to Standard

trans-unit.source: All Mobile Services sites that share a hosting plan are migrated at once.
trans-unit.target: All Mobile Services sites that share a hosting plan are migrated at once.

trans-unit.source: Mobile Services in the Free or Basic pricing tiers share
trans-unit.target: Mobile Services in the Free or Basic pricing tiers share

trans-unit.source: a hosting plan with other services in the same pricing tier and [Azure Region].
trans-unit.target: a hosting plan with other services in the same pricing tier and [Azure Region].

trans-unit.source: If your Mobile Service is operating on the Standard pricing
trans-unit.target: If your Mobile Service is operating on the Standard pricing

trans-unit.source: tier, it is located in its own hosting plan.
trans-unit.target: tier, it is located in its own hosting plan.

trans-unit.source: If you wish to individually migrate sites in the Free or Basic pricing tiers, temporarily
trans-unit.target: If you wish to individually migrate sites in the Free or Basic pricing tiers, temporarily

trans-unit.source: upgrade the Mobile Service pricing tier to Standard.
trans-unit.target: upgrade the Mobile Service pricing tier to Standard.

trans-unit.source: You can do this in the SCALE menu for your Mobile Service.
trans-unit.target: You can do this in the SCALE menu for your Mobile Service.

trans-unit.source: Log onto the [Azure Classic Portal].
trans-unit.target: Log onto the [Azure Classic Portal].

trans-unit.source: Select your Mobile Service.
trans-unit.target: Select your Mobile Service.

trans-unit.source: Select the **SCALE UP** tab.
trans-unit.target: Select the **SCALE UP** tab.

trans-unit.source: Under **Mobile Service Tier**, click on the **STANDARD** tier.
trans-unit.target: Under **Mobile Service Tier**, click on the **STANDARD** tier.

trans-unit.source: Click on the **SAVE** icon at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click on the **SAVE** icon at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: Remember to set the pricing tier to an appropriate setting after migration.
trans-unit.target: Remember to set the pricing tier to an appropriate setting after migration.

trans-unit.source: Migrating your site
trans-unit.target: Migrating your site

trans-unit.source: To migrate your site:
trans-unit.target: To migrate your site:

trans-unit.source: Log onto the [Azure Classic Portal].
trans-unit.target: Log onto the [Azure Classic Portal].

trans-unit.source: Select your Mobile Service.
trans-unit.target: Select your Mobile Service.

trans-unit.source: Click on the **Migrate to App Service** button.
trans-unit.target: Click on the **Migrate to App Service** button.

trans-unit.source: Read the Migrate to App Service dialog.
trans-unit.target: Read the Migrate to App Service dialog.

trans-unit.source: Enter the name of your Mobile Service in the box provided.
trans-unit.target: Enter the name of your Mobile Service in the box provided.

trans-unit.source: For example, if your domain name is contoso.azure-mobile.net, then enter _contoso_ in the box provided.
trans-unit.target: For example, if your domain name is contoso.azure-mobile.net, then enter _contoso_ in the box provided.

trans-unit.source: Click on the tick button.
trans-unit.target: Click on the tick button.

trans-unit.source: If you are migrating a Mobile Service in the Free or Basic pricing tiers, all Mobile Services in that pricing tier will be migrated at the same time.
trans-unit.target: If you are migrating a Mobile Service in the Free or Basic pricing tiers, all Mobile Services in that pricing tier will be migrated at the same time.

trans-unit.source: You
trans-unit.target: You

trans-unit.source: can avoid this by [raising the Mobile Service you are migrating](#opt-raise-service-tier) to Standard during the migration.
trans-unit.target: can avoid this by [raising the Mobile Service you are migrating](#opt-raise-service-tier) to Standard during the migration.

trans-unit.source: You can monitor the status of the migration in the activity monitor and your site will be listed as *migrating* in the Azure Classic Portal.
trans-unit.target: You can monitor the status of the migration in the activity monitor and your site will be listed as *migrating* in the Azure Classic Portal.

trans-unit.source: Migration Activity Monitor
trans-unit.target: Migration Activity Monitor

trans-unit.source: Each migration can take anywhere from 3 to 15 minutes per mobile service being migrated.
trans-unit.target: Each migration can take anywhere from 3 to 15 minutes per mobile service being migrated.

trans-unit.source: Your site will remain available during the migration but will be
trans-unit.target: Your site will remain available during the migration but will be

trans-unit.source: restarted at the end of the migration process.
trans-unit.target: restarted at the end of the migration process.

trans-unit.source: The site will be unavailable during the restart process, which may last a couple of seconds.
trans-unit.target: The site will be unavailable during the restart process, which may last a couple of seconds.

trans-unit.source: Finalizing the Migration
trans-unit.target: Finalizing the Migration

trans-unit.source: You should plan to test your site from a mobile client at the conclusion of the migration process.
trans-unit.target: You should plan to test your site from a mobile client at the conclusion of the migration process.

trans-unit.source: Ensure you can perform all common client actions
trans-unit.target: Ensure you can perform all common client actions

trans-unit.source: without changes to the mobile client.
trans-unit.target: without changes to the mobile client.

trans-unit.source: In addition, you should ensure that the changes you made to effect the migration (such as changing the pricing
trans-unit.target: In addition, you should ensure that the changes you made to effect the migration (such as changing the pricing

trans-unit.source: tier) are reverted if necessary.
trans-unit.target: tier) are reverted if necessary.

trans-unit.source: Select an appropriate App Service pricing tier
trans-unit.target: Select an appropriate App Service pricing tier

trans-unit.source: You have more flexibility in pricing after you migrate to Azure App Service.
trans-unit.target: You have more flexibility in pricing after you migrate to Azure App Service.

trans-unit.source: Log into the [Azure Portal].
trans-unit.target: Log into the [Azure Portal].

trans-unit.source: Select **All resources** or **App Services** then click on the name of your migrated Mobile Service.
trans-unit.target: Select **All resources** or **App Services** then click on the name of your migrated Mobile Service.

trans-unit.source: The Settings blade will open by default - if it doesn't, click on **Settings**.
trans-unit.target: The Settings blade will open by default - if it doesn't, click on **Settings**.

trans-unit.source: Click on **App Service Plan** in the Settings menu.
trans-unit.target: Click on **App Service Plan** in the Settings menu.

trans-unit.source: Click on the **Pricing Tier** tile.
trans-unit.target: Click on the **Pricing Tier** tile.

trans-unit.source: Click on the tile appropriate to your requirements, then click on **Select**.
trans-unit.target: Click on the tile appropriate to your requirements, then click on **Select**.

trans-unit.source: You may need to click on **View all** to see the available pricing tiers.
trans-unit.target: You may need to click on **View all** to see the available pricing tiers.

trans-unit.source: As a starting point, we recommend the following:
trans-unit.target: As a starting point, we recommend the following:

trans-unit.source: Mobile Service Pricing Tier
trans-unit.target: Mobile Service Pricing Tier

trans-unit.source: App Service Pricing Tier
trans-unit.target: App Service Pricing Tier

trans-unit.source: Free
trans-unit.target: Free

trans-unit.source: F1 Free
trans-unit.target: F1 Free

trans-unit.source: Basic
trans-unit.target: Basic

trans-unit.source: B1 Basic
trans-unit.target: B1 Basic

trans-unit.source: Standard
trans-unit.target: Standard

trans-unit.source: S1 Standard
trans-unit.target: S1 Standard

trans-unit.source: Note that there is considerable flexibility in choosing the right pricing tier for your application.
trans-unit.target: Note that there is considerable flexibility in choosing the right pricing tier for your application.

trans-unit.source: Refer to [App Service Pricing] for
trans-unit.target: Refer to [App Service Pricing] for

trans-unit.source: full details on the pricing of your new App Service.
trans-unit.target: full details on the pricing of your new App Service.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.TIP] The App Service Standard tier contains access to many features that you may want to use, including [staging slots],
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.TIP] The App Service Standard tier contains access to many features that you may want to use, including [staging slots],

trans-unit.source: automatic backups and auto-scaling.
trans-unit.target: automatic backups and auto-scaling.

trans-unit.source: Check out the new capabilities while you are there!
trans-unit.target: Check out the new capabilities while you are there!

trans-unit.source: Review the Migrated Scheduler Jobs
trans-unit.target: Review the Migrated Scheduler Jobs

trans-unit.source: Scheduler Jobs will not be visible until approximately 30 minutes after migration.
trans-unit.target: Scheduler Jobs will not be visible until approximately 30 minutes after migration.

trans-unit.source: Any scheduled jobs will continue to run in the background.
trans-unit.target: Any scheduled jobs will continue to run in the background.

trans-unit.source: To view your scheduled jobs:
trans-unit.target: To view your scheduled jobs:

trans-unit.source: Log into the [Azure Portal].
trans-unit.target: Log into the [Azure Portal].

trans-unit.source: Select **Browse>**, enter **Schedule** in the _Filter_ box, then select **Scheduler Collections**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Browse>**, enter **Schedule** in the _Filter_ box, then select **Scheduler Collections**.

trans-unit.source: There are a limited number of free scheduler jobs available post-migration.
trans-unit.target: There are a limited number of free scheduler jobs available post-migration.

trans-unit.source: You should review your usage and the [Azure Scheduler Plans].
trans-unit.target: You should review your usage and the [Azure Scheduler Plans].

trans-unit.source: Configure CORS if needed
trans-unit.target: Configure CORS if needed

trans-unit.source: Cross-origin resource sharing is a technique to allow a website to access a Web API on a different domain.
trans-unit.target: Cross-origin resource sharing is a technique to allow a website to access a Web API on a different domain.

trans-unit.source: If you were using Azure Mobile
trans-unit.target: If you were using Azure Mobile

trans-unit.source: Services with an associated website then you will need to configure CORS as part of the migration.
trans-unit.target: Services with an associated website then you will need to configure CORS as part of the migration.

trans-unit.source: If you were accessing Azure Mobile
trans-unit.target: If you were accessing Azure Mobile

trans-unit.source: Services exclusively from mobile devices, then CORS does not need to be configured except in rare cases.
trans-unit.target: Services exclusively from mobile devices, then CORS does not need to be configured except in rare cases.

trans-unit.source: Your migrated CORS settings are available as the **MS_CrossDomainWhitelist** App Setting.
trans-unit.target: Your migrated CORS settings are available as the **MS_CrossDomainWhitelist** App Setting.

trans-unit.source: To migrate your site to the App Service CORS facility:
trans-unit.target: To migrate your site to the App Service CORS facility:

trans-unit.source: Log into the [Azure Portal].
trans-unit.target: Log into the [Azure Portal].

trans-unit.source: Select **All resources** or **App Services** then click on the name of your migrated Mobile Service.
trans-unit.target: Select **All resources** or **App Services** then click on the name of your migrated Mobile Service.

trans-unit.source: The Settings blade will open by default - if it doesn't, click on **Settings**.
trans-unit.target: The Settings blade will open by default - if it doesn't, click on **Settings**.

trans-unit.source: Click on **CORS** in the API menu.
trans-unit.target: Click on **CORS** in the API menu.

trans-unit.source: Enter any Allowed Origins in the box provided, pressing Enter after each one.
trans-unit.target: Enter any Allowed Origins in the box provided, pressing Enter after each one.

trans-unit.source: Once your list of Allowed Origins is correct, click on the Save button.
trans-unit.target: Once your list of Allowed Origins is correct, click on the Save button.

trans-unit.source: This is an optional task, but provides for a better management experience going forward.
trans-unit.target: This is an optional task, but provides for a better management experience going forward.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.TIP] One of the advantages of using an Azure App Service is that you can run your web site and mobile service on the same site.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.TIP] One of the advantages of using an Azure App Service is that you can run your web site and mobile service on the same site.

trans-unit.source: See
trans-unit.target: See

trans-unit.source: the [next steps](#next-steps) section for more information.
trans-unit.target: the [next steps](#next-steps) section for more information.

trans-unit.source: Download a new Publishing Profile
trans-unit.target: Download a new Publishing Profile

trans-unit.source: The publishing profile of your site is changed when migrating to Azure App Service.
trans-unit.target: The publishing profile of your site is changed when migrating to Azure App Service.

trans-unit.source: You will need a new publishing profile if you intend to publsh
trans-unit.target: You will need a new publishing profile if you intend to publsh

trans-unit.source: your site from within Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: your site from within Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: To download the new publishing profile:
trans-unit.target: To download the new publishing profile:

trans-unit.source: Log into the [Azure Portal].
trans-unit.target: Log into the [Azure Portal].

trans-unit.source: Select **All resources** or **App Services** then click on the name of your migrated Mobile Service.
trans-unit.target: Select **All resources** or **App Services** then click on the name of your migrated Mobile Service.

trans-unit.source: Click on **Get publish profile**.
trans-unit.target: Click on **Get publish profile**.

trans-unit.source: The PublishSettings file will be downloaded to your computer.
trans-unit.target: The PublishSettings file will be downloaded to your computer.

trans-unit.source: It will normally be called _sitename_.PublishSettings.
trans-unit.target: It will normally be called _sitename_.PublishSettings.

trans-unit.source: You can then import the publish settings into your existing project:
trans-unit.target: You can then import the publish settings into your existing project:

trans-unit.source: Open Visual Studio and your Azure Mobile Service project.
trans-unit.target: Open Visual Studio and your Azure Mobile Service project.

trans-unit.source: Right-click on your project in the **Solution Explorer** and select **Publish...**
trans-unit.target: Right-click on your project in the **Solution Explorer** and select **Publish...**

trans-unit.source: Click on **Import**
trans-unit.target: Click on **Import**

trans-unit.source: Click on **Browse** and select your downloaded publish settings file.
trans-unit.target: Click on **Browse** and select your downloaded publish settings file.

trans-unit.source: Click on **OK**
trans-unit.target: Click on **OK**

trans-unit.source: Click on **Validate Connection** to ensure the publish settings work.
trans-unit.target: Click on **Validate Connection** to ensure the publish settings work.

trans-unit.source: Click on **Publish** to publish your site.
trans-unit.target: Click on **Publish** to publish your site.

trans-unit.source: Working with your site post-migration
trans-unit.target: Working with your site post-migration

trans-unit.source: You will start working with your new App Service in the [Azure Portal] post-migration.
trans-unit.target: You will start working with your new App Service in the [Azure Portal] post-migration.

trans-unit.source: The following are some notes on specific operations that
trans-unit.target: The following are some notes on specific operations that

trans-unit.source: you used to perform in the [Azure Classic Portal], together with their App Service equivalent.
trans-unit.target: you used to perform in the [Azure Classic Portal], together with their App Service equivalent.

trans-unit.source: Downloading and Publishing your migrated site
trans-unit.target: Downloading and Publishing your migrated site

trans-unit.source: Your site is available via git or ftp and can be re-published with a number of different mechanisms, including WebDeploy, TFS, Mercurial, GitHub,
trans-unit.target: Your site is available via git or ftp and can be re-published with a number of different mechanisms, including WebDeploy, TFS, Mercurial, GitHub,

trans-unit.source: and FTP.
trans-unit.target: and FTP.

trans-unit.source: The deployment credentials are migrated with the rest of your site.
trans-unit.target: The deployment credentials are migrated with the rest of your site.

trans-unit.source: If you did not set your deployment credentials or you do not remember
trans-unit.target: If you did not set your deployment credentials or you do not remember

trans-unit.source: them, you can reset them:
trans-unit.target: them, you can reset them:

trans-unit.source: Log into the [Azure Portal].
trans-unit.target: Log into the [Azure Portal].

trans-unit.source: Select **All resources** or **App Services** then click on the name of your migrated Mobile Service.
trans-unit.target: Select **All resources** or **App Services** then click on the name of your migrated Mobile Service.

trans-unit.source: The Settings blade will open by default - if it doesn't, click on **Settings**.
trans-unit.target: The Settings blade will open by default - if it doesn't, click on **Settings**.

trans-unit.source: Click on **Deployment credentials** in the PUBLISHING menu.
trans-unit.target: Click on **Deployment credentials** in the PUBLISHING menu.

trans-unit.source: Enter the new deployment credentials in the boxes provided, then click on the Save button.
trans-unit.target: Enter the new deployment credentials in the boxes provided, then click on the Save button.

trans-unit.source: You can use these credentials to clone the site with git or set up automated deployments from GitHub, TFS or Mercurial.
trans-unit.target: You can use these credentials to clone the site with git or set up automated deployments from GitHub, TFS or Mercurial.

trans-unit.source: For more
trans-unit.target: For more

trans-unit.source: information, see the [Azure App Service deployment documentation].
trans-unit.target: information, see the [Azure App Service deployment documentation].

trans-unit.source: Application Settings
trans-unit.target: Application Settings

trans-unit.source: Most settings for a migrated mobile service are available via App Settings.
trans-unit.target: Most settings for a migrated mobile service are available via App Settings.

trans-unit.source: You can get a list of the app settings from the [Azure Portal].
trans-unit.target: You can get a list of the app settings from the [Azure Portal].

trans-unit.source: To view or change your app settings:
trans-unit.target: To view or change your app settings:

trans-unit.source: Log into the [Azure Portal].
trans-unit.target: Log into the [Azure Portal].

trans-unit.source: Select **All resources** or **App Services** then click on the name of your migrated Mobile Service.
trans-unit.target: Select **All resources** or **App Services** then click on the name of your migrated Mobile Service.

trans-unit.source: The Settings blade will open by default - if it doesn't, click on **Settings**.
trans-unit.target: The Settings blade will open by default - if it doesn't, click on **Settings**.

trans-unit.source: Click on **Application settings** in the GENERAL menu.
trans-unit.target: Click on **Application settings** in the GENERAL menu.

trans-unit.source: Scroll to the App Settings section and find your app setting.
trans-unit.target: Scroll to the App Settings section and find your app setting.

trans-unit.source: Click on the value of the app setting to edit the value.
trans-unit.target: Click on the value of the app setting to edit the value.

trans-unit.source: Click on **Save** to save the value.
trans-unit.target: Click on **Save** to save the value.

trans-unit.source: You can update multiple app settings at the same time.
trans-unit.target: You can update multiple app settings at the same time.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.TIP] You will notice that there are two Application Settings with the same value.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.TIP] You will notice that there are two Application Settings with the same value.

trans-unit.source: For example, you may see _ApplicationKey_ and
trans-unit.target: For example, you may see _ApplicationKey_ and

trans-unit.source: _MS_ApplicationKey_.
trans-unit.target: _MS_ApplicationKey_.

trans-unit.source: You only need to alter the app setting prefixed by **MS_**.
trans-unit.target: You only need to alter the app setting prefixed by **MS_**.

trans-unit.source: However, it is a good idea to update both app settings at
trans-unit.target: However, it is a good idea to update both app settings at

trans-unit.source: the same time.
trans-unit.target: the same time.

trans-unit.source: Authentication
trans-unit.target: Authentication

trans-unit.source: All authentication settings are available as App Settings in your migrated site.
trans-unit.target: All authentication settings are available as App Settings in your migrated site.

trans-unit.source: To update your authentication settings, you must alter the
trans-unit.target: To update your authentication settings, you must alter the

trans-unit.source: appropriate app settings.
trans-unit.target: appropriate app settings.

trans-unit.source: The following table shows the appropriate app settings for your authentication provider:
trans-unit.target: The following table shows the appropriate app settings for your authentication provider:

trans-unit.source: Provider
trans-unit.target: Provider

trans-unit.source: Client ID
trans-unit.target: Client ID

trans-unit.source: Client Secret
trans-unit.target: Client Secret

trans-unit.source: Other Settings
trans-unit.target: Other Settings

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Account
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Account

trans-unit.source: MS_MicrosoftClientID
trans-unit.target: MS_MicrosoftClientID

trans-unit.source: MS_MicrosoftClientSecret
trans-unit.target: MS_MicrosoftClientSecret

trans-unit.source: MS_MicrosoftPackageSID
trans-unit.target: MS_MicrosoftPackageSID

trans-unit.source: Facebook
trans-unit.target: Facebook

trans-unit.source: MS_FacebookAppID
trans-unit.target: MS_FacebookAppID

trans-unit.source: MS_FacebookAppSecret
trans-unit.target: MS_FacebookAppSecret

trans-unit.source: Twitter
trans-unit.target: Twitter

trans-unit.source: MS_TwitterConsumerKey
trans-unit.target: MS_TwitterConsumerKey

trans-unit.source: MS_TwitterConsumerSecret
trans-unit.target: MS_TwitterConsumerSecret

trans-unit.source: Google
trans-unit.target: Google

trans-unit.source: MS_GoogleClientID
trans-unit.target: MS_GoogleClientID

trans-unit.source: MS_GoogleClientSecret
trans-unit.target: MS_GoogleClientSecret

trans-unit.source: Azure AD
trans-unit.target: Azure AD

trans-unit.source: MS_AadClientID
trans-unit.target: MS_AadClientID

trans-unit.source: MS_AadTenants
trans-unit.target: MS_AadTenants

trans-unit.source: Note: **MS_AadTenants** is stored as a comma-separated list of tenant domains (the "Allowed Tenants" fields in the Mobile Services portal).
trans-unit.target: Note: **MS_AadTenants** is stored as a comma-separated list of tenant domains (the "Allowed Tenants" fields in the Mobile Services portal).

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.WARNING] **Do not use the authentication mechanisms in the Settings menu**
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.WARNING] **Do not use the authentication mechanisms in the Settings menu**

trans-unit.source: Azure App Service provides a separate "no-code" Authentication and Authorization system under the _Authentication / Authorization_
trans-unit.target: Azure App Service provides a separate "no-code" Authentication and Authorization system under the _Authentication / Authorization_

trans-unit.source: Settings menu and the (deprecated) _Mobile Authentication_ option under the Settings menu.
trans-unit.target: Settings menu and the (deprecated) _Mobile Authentication_ option under the Settings menu.

trans-unit.source: These options are incompatible with a migrated Azure
trans-unit.target: These options are incompatible with a migrated Azure

trans-unit.source: Mobile Service.
trans-unit.target: Mobile Service.

trans-unit.source: You can [upgrade your site](app-service-mobile-net-upgrading-from-mobile-services.md) to take advantage of the Azure App Service authentication.
trans-unit.target: You can [upgrade your site](app-service-mobile-net-upgrading-from-mobile-services.md) to take advantage of the Azure App Service authentication.

trans-unit.source: Data
trans-unit.target: Data

trans-unit.source: The _Data_ tab in Mobile Services has been replaced by _Easy Tables_ within the Azure Portal.
trans-unit.target: The _Data_ tab in Mobile Services has been replaced by _Easy Tables_ within the Azure Portal.

trans-unit.source: To access Easy Tables:
trans-unit.target: To access Easy Tables:

trans-unit.source: Log into the [Azure Portal].
trans-unit.target: Log into the [Azure Portal].

trans-unit.source: Select **All resources** or **App Services** then click on the name of your migrated Mobile Service.
trans-unit.target: Select **All resources** or **App Services** then click on the name of your migrated Mobile Service.

trans-unit.source: The Settings blade will open by default - if it doesn't, click on **Settings**.
trans-unit.target: The Settings blade will open by default - if it doesn't, click on **Settings**.

trans-unit.source: Click on **Easy tables** in the MOBILE menu.
trans-unit.target: Click on **Easy tables** in the MOBILE menu.

trans-unit.source: You can add a new table by clicking on the **Add** button or access your existing tables by clicking on a table name.
trans-unit.target: You can add a new table by clicking on the **Add** button or access your existing tables by clicking on a table name.

trans-unit.source: There are a variety of operations
trans-unit.target: There are a variety of operations

trans-unit.source: you can do from this blade, including:
trans-unit.target: you can do from this blade, including:

trans-unit.source: Changing table permissions
trans-unit.target: Changing table permissions

trans-unit.source: Editing the operational scripts
trans-unit.target: Editing the operational scripts

trans-unit.source: Managing the table schema
trans-unit.target: Managing the table schema

trans-unit.source: Deleting the table
trans-unit.target: Deleting the table

trans-unit.source: Clearing the table contents
trans-unit.target: Clearing the table contents

trans-unit.source: Deleting specific rows of the table
trans-unit.target: Deleting specific rows of the table

trans-unit.source: API
trans-unit.target: API

trans-unit.source: The _API_ tab in Mobile Services has been replaced by _Easy APIs_ within the Azure Portal.
trans-unit.target: The _API_ tab in Mobile Services has been replaced by _Easy APIs_ within the Azure Portal.

trans-unit.source: To access Easy APIs:
trans-unit.target: To access Easy APIs:

trans-unit.source: Log into the [Azure Portal].
trans-unit.target: Log into the [Azure Portal].

trans-unit.source: Select **All resources** or **App Services** then click on the name of your migrated Mobile Service.
trans-unit.target: Select **All resources** or **App Services** then click on the name of your migrated Mobile Service.

trans-unit.source: The Settings blade will open by default - if it doesn't, click on **Settings**.
trans-unit.target: The Settings blade will open by default - if it doesn't, click on **Settings**.

trans-unit.source: Click on **Easy APIs** in the MOBILE menu.
trans-unit.target: Click on **Easy APIs** in the MOBILE menu.

trans-unit.source: Your migrated APIs will already be listed in the blade.
trans-unit.target: Your migrated APIs will already be listed in the blade.

trans-unit.source: You can also add a new API from this blade.
trans-unit.target: You can also add a new API from this blade.

trans-unit.source: To manage a specific API, click on the API.
trans-unit.target: To manage a specific API, click on the API.

trans-unit.source: From the new blade, you can adjust the permissions and edit the scripts for the API.
trans-unit.target: From the new blade, you can adjust the permissions and edit the scripts for the API.

trans-unit.source: Scheduler Jobs
trans-unit.target: Scheduler Jobs

trans-unit.source: All scheduler jobs are available through the Scheduler Job Collections section.
trans-unit.target: All scheduler jobs are available through the Scheduler Job Collections section.

trans-unit.source: To access your scheduler jobs:
trans-unit.target: To access your scheduler jobs:

trans-unit.source: Log into the [Azure Portal].
trans-unit.target: Log into the [Azure Portal].

trans-unit.source: Select **Browse>**, enter **Schedule** in the _Filter_ box, then select **Scheduler Collections**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Browse>**, enter **Schedule** in the _Filter_ box, then select **Scheduler Collections**.

trans-unit.source: Select the Job Collection for your site.
trans-unit.target: Select the Job Collection for your site.

trans-unit.source: It will be named _sitename_-Jobs.
trans-unit.target: It will be named _sitename_-Jobs.

trans-unit.source: Click on **Settings**.
trans-unit.target: Click on **Settings**.

trans-unit.source: Click on **Scheduler Jobs** under MANAGE.
trans-unit.target: Click on **Scheduler Jobs** under MANAGE.

trans-unit.source: Scheduled jobs will be listed with the frequency you specified prior to migration.
trans-unit.target: Scheduled jobs will be listed with the frequency you specified prior to migration.

trans-unit.source: On-demand jobs will be disabled.
trans-unit.target: On-demand jobs will be disabled.

trans-unit.source: To run an on-demand job:
trans-unit.target: To run an on-demand job:

trans-unit.source: Select the job you wish to run.
trans-unit.target: Select the job you wish to run.

trans-unit.source: If necessary, click on **Enable** to enable the job.
trans-unit.target: If necessary, click on **Enable** to enable the job.

trans-unit.source: Click on **Settings**, then **Schedule**.
trans-unit.target: Click on **Settings**, then **Schedule**.

trans-unit.source: Select a Recurrence of **Once**, then click on **Save**
trans-unit.target: Select a Recurrence of **Once**, then click on **Save**

trans-unit.source: Your on-demand jobs are located in `App_Data/config/scripts/scheduler post-migration`.
trans-unit.target: Your on-demand jobs are located in `App_Data/config/scripts/scheduler post-migration`.

trans-unit.source: We recommend that you convert all on-demand jobs to [WebJobs].
trans-unit.target: We recommend that you convert all on-demand jobs to [WebJobs].

trans-unit.source: You should write new scheduler jobs as [WebJobs].
trans-unit.target: You should write new scheduler jobs as [WebJobs].

trans-unit.source: Notification Hubs
trans-unit.target: Notification Hubs

trans-unit.source: Mobile Services uses Notification Hubs for push notifications.
trans-unit.target: Mobile Services uses Notification Hubs for push notifications.

trans-unit.source: The following App Settings are used to link the Notification Hub to your Mobile Service
trans-unit.target: The following App Settings are used to link the Notification Hub to your Mobile Service

trans-unit.source: after migration:
trans-unit.target: after migration:

trans-unit.source: Application Setting
trans-unit.target: Application Setting

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: MS_PushEntityNamespace
trans-unit.target: MS_PushEntityNamespace

trans-unit.source: The Notification Hub Namespace
trans-unit.target: The Notification Hub Namespace

trans-unit.source: MS_NotificationHubName
trans-unit.target: MS_NotificationHubName

trans-unit.source: The Notification Hub Name
trans-unit.target: The Notification Hub Name

trans-unit.source: MS_NotificationHubConnectionString
trans-unit.target: MS_NotificationHubConnectionString

trans-unit.source: The Notification Hub Connection String
trans-unit.target: The Notification Hub Connection String

trans-unit.source: MS_NamespaceName
trans-unit.target: MS_NamespaceName

trans-unit.source: An alias for MS_PushEntityNamespace
trans-unit.target: An alias for MS_PushEntityNamespace

trans-unit.source: Your Notification Hub will be managed through the [Azure Portal].
trans-unit.target: Your Notification Hub will be managed through the [Azure Portal].

trans-unit.source: Note the Notification Hub name (you can find this using the App Settings):
trans-unit.target: Note the Notification Hub name (you can find this using the App Settings):

trans-unit.source: Log into the [Azure Portal].
trans-unit.target: Log into the [Azure Portal].

trans-unit.source: Select **Browse**>, then select **Notification Hubs**
trans-unit.target: Select **Browse**>, then select **Notification Hubs**

trans-unit.source: Click on the Notification Hub name associated with the mobile service.
trans-unit.target: Click on the Notification Hub name associated with the mobile service.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Your notification hub will not be visible if it a "Mixed" type.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Your notification hub will not be visible if it a "Mixed" type.

trans-unit.source: "Mixed" type notification hubs utilize both Notification Hubs and
trans-unit.target: "Mixed" type notification hubs utilize both Notification Hubs and

trans-unit.source: legacy Service Bus features.
trans-unit.target: legacy Service Bus features.

trans-unit.source: You will need to [convert your Mixed namespaces].
trans-unit.target: You will need to [convert your Mixed namespaces].

trans-unit.source: Once the conversion is complete, your notification hub will
trans-unit.target: Once the conversion is complete, your notification hub will

trans-unit.source: appear in the [Azure Portal] .
trans-unit.target: appear in the [Azure Portal] .

trans-unit.source: For more information, review the [Notification Hubs] documentation.
trans-unit.target: For more information, review the [Notification Hubs] documentation.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.TIP] Notification Hubs management features in the [Azure Portal] is still in preview.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.TIP] Notification Hubs management features in the [Azure Portal] is still in preview.

trans-unit.source: The [Azure Classic Portal] remains available for
trans-unit.target: The [Azure Classic Portal] remains available for

trans-unit.source: managing all your Notification Hubs.
trans-unit.target: managing all your Notification Hubs.

trans-unit.source: Other App Settings
trans-unit.target: Other App Settings

trans-unit.source: The following additional app settings are migrated from your Mobile Service and available under *Settings* > *App Settings*:
trans-unit.target: The following additional app settings are migrated from your Mobile Service and available under *Settings* > *App Settings*:

trans-unit.source: Application Setting
trans-unit.target: Application Setting

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: MS_MobileServiceName
trans-unit.target: MS_MobileServiceName

trans-unit.source: The name of your app
trans-unit.target: The name of your app

trans-unit.source: MS_MobileServiceDomainSuffix
trans-unit.target: MS_MobileServiceDomainSuffix

trans-unit.source: The domain prefix.
trans-unit.target: The domain prefix.

trans-unit.source: i.e
trans-unit.target: i.e

trans-unit.source: azure-mobile.net
trans-unit.target: azure-mobile.net

trans-unit.source: MS_ApplicationKey
trans-unit.target: MS_ApplicationKey

trans-unit.source: Your application key
trans-unit.target: Your application key

trans-unit.source: MS_MasterKey
trans-unit.target: MS_MasterKey

trans-unit.source: Your app master key
trans-unit.target: Your app master key

trans-unit.source: The application key and master key should be identical to the Application Keys from your original Mobile Service.
trans-unit.target: The application key and master key should be identical to the Application Keys from your original Mobile Service.

trans-unit.source: In particular, the Application Key is
trans-unit.target: In particular, the Application Key is

trans-unit.source: sent by mobile clients to validate their use of the mobile API.
trans-unit.target: sent by mobile clients to validate their use of the mobile API.

trans-unit.source: Command Line Equivalents
trans-unit.target: Command Line Equivalents

trans-unit.source: You will no longer be able to utilize the _azure mobile_ command to manage your Azure Mobile Services site.
trans-unit.target: You will no longer be able to utilize the _azure mobile_ command to manage your Azure Mobile Services site.

trans-unit.source: Instead, many functions have been replaced
trans-unit.target: Instead, many functions have been replaced

trans-unit.source: with the _azure site_ command.
trans-unit.target: with the _azure site_ command.

trans-unit.source: Use the below table to find equivalents for common commands:
trans-unit.target: Use the below table to find equivalents for common commands:

trans-unit.source: _Azure Mobile_ Command
trans-unit.target: _Azure Mobile_ Command

trans-unit.source: Equivalent _Azure Site_ command
trans-unit.target: Equivalent _Azure Site_ command

trans-unit.source: mobile locations
trans-unit.target: mobile locations

trans-unit.source: site location list
trans-unit.target: site location list

trans-unit.source: mobile list
trans-unit.target: mobile list

trans-unit.source: site list
trans-unit.target: site list

trans-unit.source: mobile show _name_
trans-unit.target: mobile show _name_

trans-unit.source: site show _name_
trans-unit.target: site show _name_

trans-unit.source: mobile restart _name_
trans-unit.target: mobile restart _name_

trans-unit.source: site restart _name_
trans-unit.target: site restart _name_

trans-unit.source: mobile redeploy _name_
trans-unit.target: mobile redeploy _name_

trans-unit.source: site deployment redeploy _commitId_ _name_
trans-unit.target: site deployment redeploy _commitId_ _name_

trans-unit.source: mobile key set _name_ _type_ _value_
trans-unit.target: mobile key set _name_ _type_ _value_

trans-unit.source: site appsetting delete _key_ _name_
trans-unit.target: site appsetting delete _key_ _name_

trans-unit.source: site appsetting add _key_=_value_ _name_
trans-unit.target: site appsetting add _key_=_value_ _name_

trans-unit.target: mobile config list _name_

trans-unit.source: site appsetting list _name_
trans-unit.target: site appsetting list _name_

trans-unit.source: mobile config get _name_ _key_
trans-unit.target: mobile config get _name_ _key_

trans-unit.source: site appsetting show _key_ _name_
trans-unit.target: site appsetting show _key_ _name_

trans-unit.source: mobile config set _name_ _key_
trans-unit.target: mobile config set _name_ _key_

trans-unit.source: site appsetting delete _key_ _name_
trans-unit.target: site appsetting delete _key_ _name_

trans-unit.source: site appsetting add _key_=_value_ _name_
trans-unit.target: site appsetting add _key_=_value_ _name_

trans-unit.target: mobile domain list _name_

trans-unit.target: site domain list _name_

trans-unit.target: mobile domain add _name_ _domain_

trans-unit.target: site domain add _domain_ _name_

trans-unit.target: site domain delete _domain_ _name_

trans-unit.target: mobile scale show _name_

trans-unit.target: site show _name_

trans-unit.target: mobile scale change _name_

trans-unit.target: site scale mode _mode_ _name_

trans-unit.target: site scale instances _instances_ _name_

trans-unit.source: Update authentication or push notification settings by updating the appropriate Application Setting.
trans-unit.target: Update authentication or push notification settings by updating the appropriate Application Setting.

trans-unit.source: Edit files and publish your site via ftp or git.
trans-unit.target: Edit files and publish your site via ftp or git.

trans-unit.source: Diagnostics and Logging
trans-unit.target: Diagnostics and Logging

trans-unit.source: Diagnostic Logging is normally disabled in an Azure App Service.
trans-unit.target: Diagnostic Logging is normally disabled in an Azure App Service.

trans-unit.source: To enable diagnostic logging:
trans-unit.target: To enable diagnostic logging:

trans-unit.source: Log into the [Azure Portal].
trans-unit.target: Log into the [Azure Portal].

trans-unit.source: Select **All resources** or **App Services** then click on the name of your migrated Mobile Service.
trans-unit.target: Select **All resources** or **App Services** then click on the name of your migrated Mobile Service.

trans-unit.source: The Settings blade will open by default - if it doesn't, click on **Settings**.
trans-unit.target: The Settings blade will open by default - if it doesn't, click on **Settings**.

trans-unit.source: Select **Diagnostic Logs** under the FEATURES menu.
trans-unit.target: Select **Diagnostic Logs** under the FEATURES menu.

trans-unit.source: Click **ON** for the following logs: **Application Logging (Filesystem)**, **Detailed error messages** and **Failed request tracing**
trans-unit.target: Click **ON** for the following logs: **Application Logging (Filesystem)**, **Detailed error messages** and **Failed request tracing**

trans-unit.source: Click **File System** for Web server logging
trans-unit.target: Click **File System** for Web server logging

trans-unit.source: Click on **Save**
trans-unit.target: Click on **Save**

trans-unit.source: To view the logs:
trans-unit.target: To view the logs:

trans-unit.source: Log into the [Azure Portal].
trans-unit.target: Log into the [Azure Portal].

trans-unit.source: Select **All resources** or **App Services** then click on the name of your migrated Mobile Service.
trans-unit.target: Select **All resources** or **App Services** then click on the name of your migrated Mobile Service.

trans-unit.source: Click on the **Tools** button
trans-unit.target: Click on the **Tools** button

trans-unit.source: Select **Log Stream** under the OBSERVE menu.
trans-unit.target: Select **Log Stream** under the OBSERVE menu.

trans-unit.source: Logs will stream into the window provided as they are generated.
trans-unit.target: Logs will stream into the window provided as they are generated.

trans-unit.source: You can also download the logs for later analysis using your deployment credentials.
trans-unit.target: You can also download the logs for later analysis using your deployment credentials.

trans-unit.source: See
trans-unit.target: See

trans-unit.source: the [Logging] documentation for more information.
trans-unit.target: the [Logging] documentation for more information.

trans-unit.source: Next Steps
trans-unit.target: Next Steps

trans-unit.source: Not that your application is migrated to App Service, there are even more features you can leverage:
trans-unit.target: Not that your application is migrated to App Service, there are even more features you can leverage:

trans-unit.source: Deployment [staging slots] allow you to stage changes to your site and perform A/B testing.
trans-unit.target: Deployment [staging slots] allow you to stage changes to your site and perform A/B testing.

trans-unit.source: [WebJobs] provide a replacement for On-demand scheduled jobs.
trans-unit.target: [WebJobs] provide a replacement for On-demand scheduled jobs.

trans-unit.source: You can [continuously deploy] your site by linking your site to GitHub, TFS or Mercurial.
trans-unit.target: You can [continuously deploy] your site by linking your site to GitHub, TFS or Mercurial.

trans-unit.source: You can use [Application Insights] to monitor your site.
trans-unit.target: You can use [Application Insights] to monitor your site.

trans-unit.source: Serve a website and a Mobile API from the same code.
trans-unit.target: Serve a website and a Mobile API from the same code.

trans-unit.source: Upgrading your Mobile Services site to Azure Mobile Apps SDK
trans-unit.target: Upgrading your Mobile Services site to Azure Mobile Apps SDK

trans-unit.source: For Node.js-based server projects, the new [Mobile Apps Node.js SDK] provides a number of new features.
trans-unit.target: For Node.js-based server projects, the new [Mobile Apps Node.js SDK] provides a number of new features.

trans-unit.source: For instance, you can now do local development and debugging, use any Node.js version above 0.10, and customize with any Express.js middleware.
trans-unit.target: For instance, you can now do local development and debugging, use any Node.js version above 0.10, and customize with any Express.js middleware.

trans-unit.source: For .NET-based server projects, the new [Mobile Apps SDK NuGet packages](https://www.nuget.org/packages/Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server/) has more flexibility on NuGet dependencies, supports the new App Service authentication features, and composes with any ASP.NET project, including MVC.
trans-unit.target: For .NET-based server projects, the new [Mobile Apps SDK NuGet packages](https://www.nuget.org/packages/Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server/) has more flexibility on NuGet dependencies, supports the new App Service authentication features, and composes with any ASP.NET project, including MVC.

trans-unit.source: To learn more about upgrading, see [Upgrade your existing .NET Mobile Service to App Service](app-service-mobile-net-upgrading-from-mobile-services.md).
trans-unit.target: To learn more about upgrading, see [Upgrade your existing .NET Mobile Service to App Service](app-service-mobile-net-upgrading-from-mobile-services.md).
